newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends higher in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends higher in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.13 rupees up at 40.65 to the dollar on Tuesday in the kerb market as individuals offloaded dollars they had bought in hope of a devaluation, dealers said.
They said the rupee was likely to rise further as supply of the U.S. currency from abroad was also high.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on September 10, was 36.9700/37.1549 to the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 9.80 percent, compared to its previous close at 10 percent.
